moves.1. e4: usual first move e4-e5 (king's pawn game). I would of done b2-b3 (nimzo-larsen attack).
moves.1... e5: A great defense. I'm surprised she didn't played d7-d5 (Scandinavian defense).
moves.2. Nf3: Ng1-f3 (king's knight game) the usual choice of most people. (I just joined on 5-10-10)
moves.2... Nc6: Knight's defense. what a great move for black.
moves.3. Bc4: Bf1-c4 (giuoco piano) that is an Italian game.
moves.4. O-O: Castling is a great move (for all the beginners in chess)
moves.4... Bg4: The knight on f3 is pinned. It can't move or else the bishop on g4 would capture the queen on d1.
moves.5. Nc3: I brought my queen's knight out to start attacking on d5
moves.6. Nxe5: I made a risk (and a plan!)
moves.9. Nd5#:
Checkmate! (this is called a longer version of Legal's pseudo-sacrifice) 

Moral: "Look both ways before you cross the street" Said by a chess grandmaster (Not me!)

I am sorry for my horrible English.
